climbs.name: Seamingly Innocent
climbs.fa: Ken Mills, Martin Nash, Philip Wilson (91')

content.description: Somewhat slick not so great route overshadowed by the choice of anchor location.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a real stupidly placed anchor that ensures herculean efforts to retrieve ones rope.
content.location: Left-most route, some 50' left of Astro Man.

climbs.name: Glim Glam
climbs.fa: Ken Mills, Martin Nash, Philip Wilson (91')

content.description: Not much fun route (unless you're feeling generous) or absolutely have to "complete" the cliff.
content.protection: 5 bolts to an anchor that consists of slinging a tree at top some 25' back- a real bottom feeder mentality! Rappel the route to the left- Seamingly Innocent.
content.location: Center of the three (3) sport routes at the cliff.

content.description: Fun moves follow bolts with only "somewhat" adequate protection. Crux is from 4 to 5. Some loose rock, though better then most (especially the lower cliffs routes). Probably the best route on the cliff.
content.protection: 5 bolts to anchors that would have been nicer a little lower or at least with long chains.

content.description: For routes in the sun virtually all day there are three (3) basic areas: the Pond, the new wall west of Atlantis (Old Tunnel Area), and this- Sunburn Crag. Though 3 new routes exist on a lower cliff that one passes (9,10d,and a 11a), Sunburn Crag has 3 of it's own routes.
